name: SafeGuard DRM Protection
author: ArtistScope

sections.description:
This plugin adds an iFrame that manages user access rights (DRM) to the page. Can be added to any WordPress page.

NOTE: This plugin connects to a third party service for DRM protection provided by SafeGuard Media. To view DRM protected pages, users will be required to use a secure web browser known as ArtisBrowser

  • Easy install (requires WordPress Classic Editor).
  • Insert access rights (DRM) into pages and posts.
  • Settings to manage and distribute tokens for urls and users.
  • Can be viewed on Windows, Mac, iOS and Android phones.

For more information visit the SafeGuard DRM website.

Licensing

  • This plugin is free to use for 14-days after which a SafeGuard DRM account is required.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Install WordPress Classic Editor plugin.
  2. Upload the “wp-safeguard-drm” folder and its contents to the “/wp-content/plugins/” directory.
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  4. Check and modify the default settings to suit your pages.
  5. You can now add DRM to pages using the [DRM] button above the post editor.
  6. For more help see the User-Guide

NOTE: When claiming or testing DRM tokens it is strongly recommended to use a different computer to avoid exemption as Admin.

If you have problems installing, email us from the safeguard.media web site for a faster response than the WP forum.
sections.changelog:
2.7.0

  • Security update.

2.6.0

  • Prevents preview in WP editors to avoid errors.

2.5.0

  • Fixed editor DRM button.

2.4.1

  • Updated minimum version for each OS.

2.4.0

  • Fixed a bug for Mac and iOS with iFrames.

2.3.0

  • Revised post sanitisation.

2.2.0

  • Fixed a bug with Android Artisbrowser detection.

2.1.0

  • Updated token list to show tokens claimed and their ownership.

2.0.0

  • Updated to comply with WordPress requirements.

1.0.0

  • First release.
